message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SI, cs.DC 

The paper discusses the use of device-to-device (D2D) communications in millimeter-wave (mmWave) small cells for popular content downloading. This involves optimizing transmission efficiency through the exploitation of concurrent transmissions and spatial reuse. The paper also discusses the use of a transmission path selection algorithm and a concurrent transmission scheduling algorithm. Given the focus on wireless communication and networking, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses information theory and transmission rates, which suggests a possible fit with cs.IT (Information Theory). The use of mmWave bands and small cells suggests a possible fit with cs.MM (Multimedia). The focus on optimizing network performance and enhancing user experience suggests a possible fit with cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the use of scheduling algorithms suggests a possible fit with cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing).
